intro: Callothlaspi abchasicum, commonly known as the Abchazian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often opposite in arrangement. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
